content: Department of Agriculture, Agricultural Education and Agricultural Research, Uttar Pradesh, to accelerate the economy of Uttar Pradesh, to increase the income from agriculture, only by strengthening the technique of agricultural dissemination and by spreading new beneficial information to the farmer brothers, they can be connected to the stream of development. A new edition of "Krishi Gyan Manjusha" is being published with the aim of compiling the latest agricultural techniques and making the information accessible to all the farmers of the state. The book covers all the topics based on the importance of innovative geographical indications in agriculture along with traditional agriculture, Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights Act 2004, biofortified varieties developed to overcome malnutrition and cultivation of millets.

originalLanguageChunk: प्रमुख रोग : 4. सफेदा रोग 5. भूरा धब्बा 2. खैरा रोग 6. जीवाणु झुलसा 3. शीथ ब्लाइट 7. जीवाणु धारी 4. झोंका रोग 8... मभिथ्या कण्डुआ 4. सफेंदा रोग : यह रोग लौह तत्व की कमी के कारण नर्सरी में अधिक लगता है। नई पत्ती कागज के समान सफेद रंग की निकलती है। 2. खैरा रोग : यह रोग जिंक की कमी के कारण होता है। इस रोग में पत्तियाँ पीली पड़ जाती हैं, जिस पर बाद में कत्थई रंग के धब्बे बन जाते हैं

content: 3. Sheath Blight: In this disease irregularly shaped spots form on the leaf sheath, the edge of which is dark brown and the centre is light in colour. 4. heading: Unnatashil of Paddy, Shat
originalLanguageChunk: 3. शीथ ब्लाइट : इस रोग में पत्र कंचुल (शीथ) पर अनियमित आकार के धब्बे बनते हैं, जिसका किनारा गहरा भूरा तथा मध्य भाग हल्के रंग का होता है। 4. झोंका रोग : इस रोग में पत्तियों परआँख की आकृति के धब्बे बनते हैं, जो मध्य में राख के रंग के तथा किनारे गहरे कत्थई रंग के होते हैं

content: Rice is one of the world's three important food crops, the staple food of 2.7 billion people. It is cultivated on about 450 million hectares in the world and 435 million hectares in Asia. Paddy is cultivated on about 44 million hectares in India and about 5. 9 million hectares in Uttar Pradesh under various conditions: irrigated, non-irrigated, inundated, non-irrigated, and flood-prone areas. Emphasis needs to be laid on the development of high-yielding hybrids of paddy for different conditions, that is, suitable irrigated and heterogeneous conditions. The first hybrid development program began in China in 4964. Hybrids developed after 20 years of tireless efforts have yielded 45-20% higher yields than normal varieties because of the hybrid vigor and effective root system, which is moderately resistant to drought and soil salinity.
heading: Sustainable cultivation of paddy. Sustainable rice crops. 2. Sustainable cultivation of hybrid rice
originalLanguageChunk: धान विश्व की तीन महत्वपूर्ण खाद्यान्न फसलों में सेएक है जोकि 2.7 बिलियन लोगों का मुख्य भोजन है। इसकी खेती विश्व में लगभग 450 मिलियन हेक्टेयर एवं एशिया में 435 मिलियन हेक्टेयर में की जाती है| भारतवर्ष में लगभग 44 मिलियन हेक्टेयर तथा उत्तर प्रदेश में करीब 5.9 मिलियन हेक्टेयर में धान की खेती विभिनन परिस्थितियों : सिंचित, असिंचित, जल प्लावित, असिंचित ऊसरीली एवं बाढ़ प्रभावित क्षेत्रों में कीजाती है| विभिनन परिस्थितियों अर्थात् अनुकूल सिंचित एवं विषम परिस्थितियों हेतु धान की उच्च उत्पादकता वाली संकर प्रजातियों केविकास पर बल दिये जाने की आवश्यकता है। सर्वप्रथम संकर प्रजातियों केविकास का कार्यक्रम चीन में वर्ष 4964 में आरम्म हुआ | पिछले 20 वर्षों के अथक प्रयासों के उपरान्त विकसित संकर प्रजातियों से सामान्य प्रजातियों के सापेक्ष 45--20 प्रतिशत अधिक उत्पादन प्राप्त होरहा है क्योंकि इनमें उपलब्ध संकर ओज एवं प्रभावी जड़तंत्र, सूखा एवं मृदा लवणता के प्रति मध्यम स्तर का अवरोधी होता है

content: It is to be noted that hybrids are developed by hybridization / interbreeding of species with two different genetic traits, kenar and mada, in which the seed of the first generation is used as the new variety because the first generation has a unique ooze capacity, which is able to give more yield than the best common varieties. Note that in the next generation, due to the disintegration of their combined qualities, the ooze capacity is greatly reduced and the yield is reduced.

content: Sowing Time: The best time to sow mustard is from 45 June to 45 July. It should be sown with the onset of monsoon.As soon as the start is made, it is appropriate to prepare the field well by doing the first ploughing with a soil turning plough and two or three ploughing ploughs. Soil treatment: 2.5 kg of Trichoderma 2% WP to protect the crop from soil-borne diseases. Volume per hectare 60-75 kg. After spraying light water mixed with cow dung manure and keeping it in shade for 8-40 days, at the time of last ploughing, add 2.5 kg of Beauveria baesiana biopesticide to protect the fields from pests like termites, white weeds, nematodes, root worms, cutworms, etc. Volume per hectare 60-75 kg. Light water mixed with cow dung manure should be sprinkled and mixed in the soil at the last ploughing before sowing after keeping it in shade for 8-40 days.

content: Use and Importance of Biofertilizers in Sugarcane Crop: The inclusion of non-perishable species in sugarcane cultivation and intensive cultivation results in the requirement of adequate amounts of different nutrients to nourish the crops which are supplied by the farmers through chemical fertilizers only. Excessive use of chemical fertilizers adversely affects the physical and chemical properties of the soil. At the same time, due to the ever-increasing price of chemical fertilizers, farmers are not able to use nutrients according to the demand of the crops, which also affects the crop yield.

originalLanguageChunk: केसिरे तक बन के अन्त तक जाती है। बाद में ये पत्तियां सूख जाती हैं और कडी हो जाती है। गन्ने की आंखें नीचे सेऊपर की ओर अंकुरित हो जाती हैं जो बाद में सूख जाती हैं। गन्ने को चीरे पर गूदे में गहरे लाल अथवा भूरे रंग की समान्तर धारिया पड़ जाती है जो गांठों परऔर घनी होती हैं। पत्ती की सीडोमोनास रूबिलिनियन्स |जून से सितम्बर गन्ने की पत्तियों परलाल अथवा लाल भूरे रंग की लालधारी समानान्तर धारियाँ निचली सतह पर पड़ जाती है जिनमें से शाकाणु की उजिंग प्रातः तड़के अथवा वर्षा पश्चात निचली सतह पर पाया जाता है। कभी-कभी धारियां इतनी अधिक हो जाती हैं कि पूरी लाल दिखने लगती है। पत्तियों को क्लोरोफिल समाप्त हो जाता है। इस रोग से फसल के बढ़वार पर प्रतिकूल प्रभाव पड़ता है। विवर्ण रोग फाइटोप्लाज्मा फसल के वर्षा काल में इस रोग के लक्षण अधिक स्पष्ट होते लत के है। प्राथमिक संक्रमण में नये किललों की पत्तियों अन्त तक दूधिया सफेद रंग की निकलती है। इन किल्लों में अचानक ब्यांत बहुत अधिक बढ़ जाती है। ब्यांत बहुत पतले होते हैं। इस प्रकार एक झाड़ीनुमा थान बन जाता है जो कि बाद में सूख जाता है। ऐसे थानों में गन्ना बहुत कम बन पाता है तथा छोटा होता है। गन्ने की पोरियाँ भी छोटी होती है। गन्ने की सभी आंखे अपरिपक्व अवस्था में ही अंकुरित हो जाती है तथा उसमें से भी सफेद पत्तियाँ निकलती है जो गन्ने

content: It is the unfermented corn of the maize plant, which is harvested and used within 2-3 days of the arrival of the silkworm. Baby maize is used in the form of salads, soups, vegetables, pickles and candies, pakoras, koftas, tikkis, curries, hot barfi laddoos, halwa, kheer, etc. Baby maize is a tasty and nutritious food and is free from the effects of pesticides due to its leaf-wrapping properties. Phosphorus is abundantly available in baby maize. In addition, it contains no carbohydrates, proteins, calcium, iron, or vitamins. Due to its cholesterol-free and high fiber content, it is a low-calorie food that is highly beneficial to diabetics. Productive Techniques: Except for the large number of plants, high nitrogen content, and quick harvesting, all plant functions of infant maize are similar to maize.

content: Sunflowers can be cultivated in all three seasons, kharif, rabi and zaid, but in kharif, sunflowers are prone to many diseases and pests. The flowers are small and have few seeds. Good yield of sunflower can be obtained in zaid. Land and climate: Sunflower can be cultivated in all types of land, but heavy land with high water retention is suitable. It can be successfully cultivated in all types of land with fixed irrigation, excluding acidic and alkaline land. Techniques related to animal feed nutrition: Various chemical and biological methods have been used to increase the nutrient value of wheat and paddy straw, which is an inexpensive technique. Scientists at NDRI, Karnal (Haryana) have developed a urea molasses mineral mixture that improves the ability of growing animals to use the straw. This compensator is used to save animals during natural calamities. This urea molasses lick the mineral mass with animal flavour. The problem of procuring traditional feed for animals is of particular importance in itself. Therefore, appropriate technology has been developed to use agro-waste by-products as animal feed and to remove toxic elements in some agro-pastures like Mahua, Khali, Neem-Khali, Sal seed feed so that they can be used as animal feed. Recycled aquaculture systems mainly consist of fish tanks, mechanical filters, biofilters, trickling filters, degassers, oxygen enrichment units, and UV light. There are disinfectants. content: Fish tanks of RAS fisheries: Tanks for aquaculture or pisciculture in these systems can be of any size such as rectangular, circular, oval, etc. Mostly circular or oval tanks are preferred, as they are easier to maintain and facilitate easy water circulation. Rectangular tanks are usually used in the desired area. Fishing tank sizes can range from 500 to 500,000 gallons capacity and depend on factors such as fish type, stock rate, water requirement, and quality. The tank should be made so that it is compatible with other components of the system. Materials required to make the tank can be metal, wood, glass, rubber, concrete, or plastic. Any material that is non-toxic and insoluble can be used to build the tank. The inner surface of the tank should be clean and smooth. Each material used for this purpose has its own advantages and disadvantages.

The biological activity of the filter and the amount of carbon dioxide produced in the nitrification process in the tankNitrification of RAS fisheries: The process of detoxifying ammonia is called nitrification. The principle is the conversion of ammonia nitrogen to less toxic nitrogen dioxide and finally nitrification to non-toxic nitrates through bacterial action. For this process, bacteria are grown on a surface and normal temperature clean water should be used. The bacteria required for this process are of two types |एक which converts ammonia to nitrogen dioxide is called 'Nitrosomonas bacteria' and the other which converts nitrogen dioxide to nitrate is called 'Nitrobacter bacteria'. The entire process of nitrification is agobic in nature and requires oxygen. The minimum amount of oxygen required to replace 4 mg of ammonia is around 5 mg. In addition, bacteria require an additional 5 mg of oxygen to survive.

content: Humidity: Humidity is also of great importance in broiler rearing.Spread evenly over a large area and moving around indicates a good temperature. Chicks congregating near a light source indicates lower temperatures, while those congregating around a brooder guard indicate higher temperatures. In this way, the temperature can be reduced or increased by observing the condition of the chicks. Experiments show that 33 ° C is best for two to three days after initiation, and then the temperature should be reduced to 2.5 ° C per week until it reaches 24 ° C or room temperature. 24 ° C has been found to be best in the Grover stage.

content: Lighting: In kukut farming, lighting is usually done with an electric bulb, so that the room temperature remains appropriate along with the light.The pungent ammonia odor and dampness of the bedding indicate insufficient airflow, while the dryness of the bedding and the ammonia-free odor of the room indicate adequate airflow. Care is also very important to ensure that no gusts of wind enter the room. The chicks will also tell if there is a gust of wind in the room. The chicks gathering in one part of the brooder is indicative of a gust of wind.

content: They are used and kept dark for 4 hours, whether the nest is open or without windows or skylights. Occasional periods of darkness are considered necessary so that the bird is not forced to react if the power supply suddenly goes out at any time. But according to the latest research, if the windowless habitat is kept dark for 2-4 hours after the initial 4-2 hours of power supply in a 24-hour power supply interval, it improves the bird's feeding ability. Many kukut keepers, who have windowless housing, have benefited from the above method.
